intro: Buchnera pruinosa, commonly known as the Pruinose Buchnera, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Buchnera pruinosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
